result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S. Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid in full during term of probation.    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If agent recommends, attend and successfully complete domestic violence programming.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

Find time served.
Concurrent with: any sentence now serving.

records.addlTxt: Judgment/Notice of Entry of Judgment returned "Return to Sender Attempted Not Known Unable to Forward"

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fudge.  Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended:  90 days jail.  Concurrent with the sentences he is now serving.  Victim present.  No statement by the vicitm.  Attorney Fudge agreed with the State's recommendation.  Court ordered:  90 days jail.  Concurrent with the sentences he is now serving.   Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  192 days credit.  Find time served.
Per Agent Gigous - he would like the respective Judge on each case to have revocation hearings and not have just one Judge handle them both in regards to 11CF8 and 15CM247.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Along with Revocation Summary (routed to Judge and J.A.)
From DOC Agent Gigous to Judge along with ROAW
Probation extended to 1/11/19

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson. Plead guilty to 15CM247 as charged.  Victim notification complied with.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood. Court confirmed prior conviction.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for 1 year  probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA.  o/m employment.  DV counseling.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA as agent recommends.  Subject to random alcohol testing by his agent.  Participate in treatment/counseling agent recommends.    Obtain and maintain employment. Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.  Domestic violence counseling, if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Domestic abuse surcharge.  Pay in full during term of probation.  Report to probation by Friday noon of this week.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.  Defendant did not appear.  Employer would not let him off for today without punishment.  Reschedule with RIP.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
